summary: This document is an email chain from Richard C. Curtiss to the New York Post, inquiring about coverage of Jeffrey Epstein's death and Ghislaine Maxwell's case, while alleging personal knowledge from being inside the prisons. It includes forwarded official responses regarding Epstein's death and FOIA procedures.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York City. The coroner ruled the death a suicide by hanging.

events.title: OCME Correspondence on Epstein Death

events.title: Inquiry to NY Post about Epstein/Maxwell
events.description: Richard C. Curtiss emailed the New York Post asking if they plan to write stories about Epstein's death and Maxwell's case, while making allegations about prison conditions.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York City, NY
keyFacts: Richard C. Curtiss claims to have been inside Jeffrey Epstein's cell in the SHU (Special Housing Unit) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Curtiss alleges that cameras and backup cameras were turned off by guards when Epstein died, and that a 'Goon Squad' uses camcorders to record incidents when official cameras are off.
The NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner officially confirmed Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, was ruled a suicide by hanging.
Bureau of Prisons Director Kathleen Sawyer testified that the FBI was investigating whether a 'criminal enterprise' played a role in Epstein's death, despite the official suicide ruling.
The document includes a forwarded FOIA response indicating that specific information about Epstein (BOP Inmate Number 08448-055) must be requested through a formal FOIA process.
